Left or Right N characters of a string

Source: R/other_functions.R
left.Rd

This functions lets the user extract the first or last n characters of a string or vector of strings.

left(string, n = 1)

right(string, n = 1)

Arguments

string

String or Vector.

n

Integer. How many characters starting on right/left?

Value

Character. Trimmed strings.

See also

Other Data Wrangling: balance_data(), categ_reducer(), cleanText(), date_cuts(), date_feats(), formatNum(), holidays(), impute(), normalize(), numericalonly(), ohe_commas(), ohse(), removenacols(), removenarows(), replaceall(), textFeats(), textTokenizer(), vector2text(), year_month()

Examples

left("Bernardo", 3)
#> [1] "Ber"
right(c("Bernardo", "Lares", "V"), 3)
#> [1] "rdo" "res" "V"
